conclusion: Analyze the path liquid would take from points A, B, C, and D to containers E or F considering baffle obstacles.
Liquid starts at point A (blue starting point) and flows downward.
Liquid from point A might hit the black baffle and then potentially the orange baffle.
Liquid from point A would be directed to container E (blue).
Liquid starts at point B (mint/teal starting point) and flows downward.
Liquid from point B would likely flow between the red and purple baffles.
Liquid from point B appears directed toward container E (blue).
Liquid starts at point C (yellow starting point) and flows downward.
Liquid from point C would likely encounter and possibly be deflected by the red baffle.
Liquid from point C appears headed toward container F (yellow).
Liquid starts at point D (orange starting point) and flows downward.
Liquid from point D would encounter the purple baffle which would deflect it.
Liquid from point D would likely end up in container F (yellow).
Final answer: Liquid from point A goes to container E, from point B goes to container E, from point C goes to container F, from point D goes to container F.
